data.title: Test Runner Viewlet with an Extension API to plug into [Enhancement Request]
data.body:
[In response to Erich Gamma's tweet](https://twitter.com/ErichGamma/status/755437588291485697) @Krzysztof-Cieslak

A test runner viewlet/sidebar with a pluggable API would be a great addition to vscode. 

The viewlet should include visual indications of 
- the progress of completed tests out of the set of tests being run
- visual indicators or icons showing basic tests states at the least 
  `not run |  success | failure | ignored/skipped`

![](http://i.imgur.com/Rt4uw9S.png)

The test runner should be able to provide a set of sorting categories and repopulate the viewlet based on the users selection

![](http://i.imgur.com/MhP5Elk.png)

A query box with the ability to filter the tests based on the names shown in the runner's list at a minimum, with the ability for the underlying runner to populate a set of query filters.

![](http://i.imgur.com/062i5zz.png)

Instead of the VS style of collapsing categories

![](http://i.imgur.com/GivhUBv.png)

I think the vscode style used in the debugger viewlet is much nicer :smile: 

![](http://i.imgur.com/iOFmimd.png)

A button could be used to select which test runner you want to use out of the test runner extensions that have been installed

![](http://i.imgur.com/7P5ljMa.png)

But a dropdown menu would work too

![](http://i.imgur.com/KA1fG2r.png)

A side button to open a menu could enable the active test runner to populate it with any additional commands specific to its functionality 

![](http://i.imgur.com/QDh2Wu3.png)

Some other functionality points -
- When an individual test is selected the result could be rendered in the output panel
- An icon/button to run all tests
- The ability to highlight/select a set of tests and only run those tests 
- A basic set of run options, which individual runners might be able to extend  
  ![](http://i.imgur.com/BkYPZfB.png)
- Tests outputs can contain links to specific points in source code
- Debugging specific tests (would be awesome, but understandable if this is too difficult for an initial implementation)
- Associate test runner extensions with specific languages?
- Test playlists (would be nice, but not especially important)
- Ability to specify a task/trigger that will repopulate the viewlet's list of tests
- Dropdown menu that the test runner can population with platform/environment/runtime configurations to use during test execution.

data.title: Autocomplete annoyingly tries to complete in comments.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: not likely relevant, but it's Windows 7

I'm new to Visual Studio Code, so be gentle.  There is new behavior in VSCode (or at least I don't remember it in the past).  I don't know if it's part of the base VSCode, part of Microsoft's C/C++ extension that I installed, or some combination of both.  But the end effect is that when I'm typing in a comment (either // or /\* */ style), the autocomplete popup decides to show itself when it sees text that it knows.  An example:
1. Type "// This isn't fun"
2. Autocomplete will now popup, offering to complete "fun".
3. The word I wanted was indeed fun, so I type space.
4. Autocomplete changes "fun " to "function" for me.
5. Now I have to go back and edit it.

Similar things happen when I'm typing a period to end a sentence.  Autocomplete sees this as an opportunity to try to turn a simple period into a dereference to a member.

The issue is that while having autocomplete do this on code is exactly what I want, having it do this when I'm typing comments is exactly what I don't.

data.title: Open file with fuzzy search on workspace
data.body:
I can't find a way to open a file under the current directory using visual studio code.
Ideally it would be like `CMD+P` but instead of opening only the recent ones, it will fuzzy search any file within the directory. 
I searched among the key bindings commands but did not find anything useful. Am I missing something ?

data.title: Feature Request: Enable emmet for other file extensions.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 - OS Version: Ubuntu 16.06 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install `Nunjucks` plugin. 2. Type `p` and press tab. 3. `\t` was inserted. Expected Result: 1. `p` expanded to `

`. I was looking for the setting to enable `emmet`, but it seems hard-coded in the source ([src/vs/workbench/parts/emmet/node/editorAccessor.ts#L20](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/emmet/node/editorAccessor.ts#L20)). Can we modify this value through preference? Thanks.

data.title: Tyepscript beta 2.0 - Error still shown for Experimental Decorators (even with flag true in tsconfig)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: **1.3.1**
- OS Version: **Win7**

Steps to Reproduce:

**1.** Typescript 2 beta installed & setup with `tsdk` in vscode settings.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2574412/16962331/18aa3bee-4dbf-11e6-8f28-c1316f195089.png)

**2.** Experimental decorators flag set to `true`
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2574412/16962406/6f65e4ec-4dbf-11e6-9188-2ed283bd5673.png)

**3.** Use Decorator (Angular2 in this case) on a class, notice the error

```
import { Component } from '@angular/core';

@Component({ })
export class Home {
}
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2574412/16962365/374399d8-4dbf-11e6-9f26-befb8fd8e1b4.png)

data.title: Allow to save a list of opened editors in a group and switch between them

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: all

There are many times I have a set of open editors in the middle of working on something but need to stop and look at a completely different part of the project.

Currently, I can:
1. Just open the new set of files I need, which clutters up the open editors
2. Close my open editors and open the new set of files, which makes it easier to work on the second part but very difficult to get back to the previous state when I need to

It would be nice to be able to save a state of which editors and files are open to retrieve later so I could save the state, close everything, and switch to the new set of files, then easily restore the initial state when I'm finished.

This is my main use case for wanting to be able to open multiple windows. See #7330 #2686

data.title: Editing history is lost when using onFocusChange
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 (1.3.1)
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

After last update, when using  `"files.autoSave": "onFocusChange"` on user settings and when change editing file by choosing file on left sidebar, history from the previous file history is lost.

Steps to reproduce:

1 - Edit some file, change it many times.
2 - Try CMD + Z -> it works.
3 - Change to another file, by changing clicking on LEFT SIDEBAR Explorer folder files
4 - Back to the previous edited file.
5 - Try using CMD + Z -> does not work. History is lost

ps.: This behavior starts on last update.

data.title: VSCode markes newly opened files as modified
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14372

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder
2. Open any file in that folder

VSCode marks every file I open as being modified, even though I haven't touched them.  The modified indicator shows up in both the tab label and the open files section of the sidebar.

data.title: How about add a new plugin 'code map'?
data.body: I have used several editor like sublime, atom,webstorm and so on, they all have the code map itself or the plugin, while there are too many lines of code, the code map may help us go to somewhere faster, so I wish it that vscode can also have this kind plugin, I long for it.

data.title: Duplicated file name with case rename
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

Unfortunately I'm not able to reproduce easily
1. TS task was running
2. Created file `AwesomePlete.ts`
3. Renamed file to `Awesomeplete.ts`
4. VSCode shows both of the files here:
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/16955467/bbed09ca-4da2-11e6-87ad-12a71e3936b3.png)

If I select `AwesomPlete.ts` it opens `Awesomplete.ts`
Restarting VScode does not help (not sure if vscode keeps some cache or something)

If I open this project in 1.3.1 then it does not have this problem

data.title: fixes glibc dep issue on rhel 6
data.body:
resolves #9487.

The RPM for RHEL 6.7 x64 does not work as it fails dependency checks. The spec file for the rpm specifies glibc >= 2.15 while 2.12 is the latest thats available in RHEL 6.

data.title: RPM does not work with RHEL 6.7
data.body:
The RPM for RHEL 6.7 x64 does not work as it fails dependency checks.  The spec file for the rpm specifies glibc >= 2.15 while 2.12 is the latest thats available in RHEL 6.  I'll be opening a PR for the fix...

/cc @davebachmann

data.title: JSX formatter removes space between sentences in component plain text content.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a new file and save it somewhere as test.jsx. 2. Add the following content to the file: `
Sentence one. Sentence two. Sentence three.
` 3. Format the file. 4. The file will be altered to: `
Sentence one.Sentence two.Sentence three.
` This also happens with question marks and exclamation points at the end of sentences.

data.title: Integrated terminal can't find __git_ps1
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan (10.11.6)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add the following to ~/.bash_profile

```
# Enable tab completion
source ~/git-completion.bash
# colors!
green="\[\033[0;32m\]"
blue="\[\033[0;34m\]"
purple="\[\033[0;35m\]"
reset="\[\033[0m\]"
# Change command prompt
source ~/git-prompt.sh
export GIT_PS1_SHOWDIRTYSTATE=1
# '\u' adds the name of the current user to the prompt
# '\$(__git_ps1)' adds git-related stuff
# '\W' adds the name of the current directory
export PS1="$purple\u$green\$(__git_ps1)$blue \W $ $reset"
```
1. Open integrated terminal. Every line is now prefixed with this error
   ![screen shot 2016-07-19 at 9 09 07 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14034112/16950915/8969fd30-4d90-11e6-8214-eed0b947a890.png)

Note, the system terminal does not have this error and properly displays __git_ps1
![screen shot 2016-07-19 at 9 11 12 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14034112/16950963/c88a9754-4d90-11e6-8b5e-69d956949426.png)

data.title: Restart frame not working as expected
data.body:
Have the following code:

``` js
console.log('hello world');
console.log('hello world 2');
```

Set a breakpoint on the second line, start debugging and once the breakpoint is hit restart frame. Notice that the frame is not restarted, but program hits an entry frame stop and continues till exit

![replayframe](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16950213/5fe2fa46-4dbf-11e6-8f00-4af7cdf736fa.gif)

data.title: Closing brackets between tags

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 - OS Version: Windows 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Typing `
` and places the cursor in between. 2. Insert a { no closing curly brace is inserted and it looks like this `
{
`. However, if i add a space after and then move the cursor back one step the closing curly brace gets inserted correctly and the result looks like this `
{}
`

data.title: Breakpoints are all unverified when debugging extensions if there is no network access
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-Insiders and 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open an extension project
2. Add breakpoints to `activate` function
3. Turn off network (Air plane mode), launch the extension from VS Code

If there is network access, the breakpoint is hit succesfully. If not, the breakpoint is never hit. Besides, when there is no network, when you launch the extension, the breakpoint icon on the gutter is red (meaning it's valid) but if you remove it then re-add a breakpoint, the newly added breakpoint is grey and the hint is saying `unverified breakpoint`.

I don't see this problem when debugging nodejs project, it onlys happens with extentions (repro this issue with VSCodeVim, Alex's Vim and vscode-encourage).

data.title: [Terminal] Run entire text if selection is empty
data.body:
Since VS Code already has great built-in support for the terminal, it would be good to merge the function of this [Terminal extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.terminal) now. 
VS Code has support to run the selected text in terminal and another common scenario would be: when user open a file (maybe a bash or cmd file), he wants to run the entire file in terminal. 
Therefore, it would be useful that user could run the entire text of current active text editor conveniently. To make this, I suggest we support to run the entire text when the selection is empty. Simple and effective.

data.title: Setting 'openFilesInNewWindow' should be 'false'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open one VS code instance with some tabs
2. Open file from OS (windows explorer)

Expected Result: File from explorer opens in last active window

Actual Result: New VSCode instance opens

Related issues: [#3191](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3191)

Comments: Agreed with @thewhitetulip. This breaks the expected UX flow, no other editor/IDE (I.E sublime) opens a new instance if one is already open. Using CLI arguments is an option, but opening a new instance should be a flag, not opening in the last active window.

data.title: It is not possible to select multiple file from the file explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Win 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

It is not possible to select multiple file from the file explorer of vs code like ctrl+click or shift+click. To perform operation as delete, copy etc.

data.title: [css] Intellisense unaware of user-select css property.
data.body:
Intellisense is incorrectly reporting that the CSS property `user-select:none` is unknown yet it's currently in use with all modern browsers including internet explorer from IE 11 onwards [as listed on caniuse](http://caniuse.com/#feat=user-select-none)
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create Any CSS element and use the property `user-select:none`
2. Intellisense will now report a warning stating '[css] Unknown property.'

data.title: inconsistency in "Javascript React" or JSX syntax highlighting with { bracket-enclosed expressions }
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.4.0-insider (f4780e67933164a2289b86f2c279aaa05fda672f, 2016-07-19T05:12:40.233Z) - OS Version: Linux x64 4.2.0-42-generic **Issue**: Inconsistent syntax highlighting with "Javascript React" or JSX with `{ bracket-enclosed javascript expressions }` depending on whether their enclosing JSX element have properties, like: ``` jsx { thing.map(x =>
{x}
) } ``` or ``` jsx
{ thing.map(x =>
{x}
) }
``` Which will highlight differently when the element properties are removed, like: ``` jsx { thing.map(x=>
{x}
) } ``` or ``` jsx
{ thing.map(x =>
{x}
) }
```
